magicbook.gtlitecore.client.model.vertex

类 VertexArrayObjects

  • java.lang.Object
    • magicbook.gtlitecore.client.model.vertex.VertexArrayObjects

  • public final class VertexArrayObjects
extends java.lang.Object
    Universal methods for handling Vertex Array Objects (VAO) in the OpenGL versions supported by minecraft. Uses the GL3.0 VAO methods if available and fallbacks to GL_APPLE_vertex_array_object or ARB_vertex_array_object if needed. This should cover pretty much any GL 2.1-capable hardware.
    作者:
    eigenraven

    • 构造器概要

      static void reinitializeGlContext()
      Resets the cached VAO implementation for this thread, any further method calls will query the GLContext capabilities again on first call.

    • 构造器详细资料

      • VertexArrayObjects

        public VertexArrayObjects()

    • 方法详细资料

      • reinitializeGlContext

        public static void reinitializeGlContext()
        Resets the cached VAO implementation for this thread, any further method calls will query the GLContext capabilities again on first call.

      • getVertexArrayBinding

        public static int getVertexArrayBinding()
        Equivalent to glGetInteger(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY_BINDING) for the currently used VAO extension.
        返回:
        The identifier of the currently bound VAO, or 0 if none is bound.

      • genVertexArrays

        public static int genVertexArrays()
        Generates a single vertex array object name.
        另请参阅:
        genVertexArrays(IntBuffer)

      • genVertexArrays

        public static void genVertexArrays(java.nio.IntBuffer output)
        genVertexArrays(IntBuffer) returns n vertex array object names in arrays.

        There is no guarantee that the names form a contiguous set of integers; however, it is guaranteed that none of the returned names was in use immediately before the call to genVertexArrays(IntBuffer).

        Vertex array object names returned by a call to genVertexArrays(IntBuffer) are not returned by subsequent calls, unless they are first deleted with deleteVertexArrays(IntBuffer).

        The names returned in arrays are marked as used, for the purposes of genVertexArrays(IntBuffer) only, but they acquire state and type only when they are first bound.

        Errors

        GL11.GL_INVALID_VALUE is generated if n is negative.

      • deleteVertexArrays

        public static void deleteVertexArrays(int id)
        Frees a single vertex array object name.
        参数:
        id - The name to free
        另请参阅:
        deleteVertexArrays(IntBuffer)

      • deleteVertexArrays

        public static void deleteVertexArrays(java.nio.IntBuffer ids)
        deleteVertexArrays(IntBuffer) deletes n vertex array objects whose names are stored in the array addressed by arrays. Once a vertex array object is deleted it has no contents and its name is again unused. If a vertex array object that is currently bound is deleted, the binding for that object reverts to zero and the default vertex array becomes current. Unused names in arrays are silently ignored, as is the value zero.

        Errors

        GL11.GL_INVALID_VALUE is generated if n is negative.

      • isVertexArray

        public static boolean isVertexArray(int array)
        isVertexArray returns true if array is currently the name of a vertex array object. If the array is zero, or if array is not the name of a vertex array object, or if an error occurs, isVertexArray returns false. If array is a name returned by genVertexArrays(IntBuffer), by that has not yet been bound through a call to bindVertexArray(int), then the name is not a vertex array object and glIsVertexArray returns false.

      • bindVertexArray

        public static void bindVertexArray(int id)
        bindVertexArray(int) binds the vertex array object with name array. array is the name of a vertex array object previously returned from a call to genVertexArrays(IntBuffer), or zero to break the existing vertex array object binding.

        If no vertex array object with name array exists, one is created when array is first bound. If the bind is successful no change is made to the state of the vertex array object, and any previous vertex array object binding is broken.

        Errors

        GL11.GL_INVALID_OPERATION is generated if array is not zero or the name of a vertex array object previously returned from a call to genVertexArrays(IntBuffer).
